content: * *Keppel Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore) represented in the [Legislative Council of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore) from 1951 until 1955. It elected one Legislative Council member. The constituency was held by [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock), leader of the [Labour Party](/wiki/Labour_Party_(Singapore)). The constituency was formed from [Municipal South-West Constituency](/wiki/Municipal_South-West_Constituency) in 1951. In 1955, the constituency was abolished and split into [Havelock](/wiki/Havelock_Constituency), [Pasir Panjang](/wiki/Pasir_Panjang_Constituency), [Queenstown](/wiki/Queenstown_Constituency), [Southern Islands](/wiki/Southern_Islands_Constituency), [Tanjong Pagar](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Constituency) and [Tiong Bahru constituencies](/wiki/Tiong_Bahru_Constituency). ## Legislative Council member YearMemberParty(/wiki/1951_Singaporean_general_election)[Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock)[LP](/wiki/Labour_Party_(Singapore)) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1951](/wiki/1951_Singaporean_general_election): Keppel PartyCandidateVotes%Â±%**[Labour Party](/wiki/Labour_Party_(Singapore))****[Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock)** **2,369** **68.0** [PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))[Arumugam Ponnu Rajah](/wiki/Arumugam_Ponnu_Rajah)1,11732.0[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)1,25236.0[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)3,55553.2[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)6,683[Labour Party](/wiki/Labour_Party_(Singapore)) **win** This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. title: Keppel Constituency
